result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheriana M Finley-Sykes

records.addlTxt: Order Appointing Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Sheriana M Finley-Sykes appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Eric Hailstock appeared by phone means as a Friend of the Court.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Indigency hearing proceeded.  
Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  
The court appointed Attorney Eric Hailstock to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. 
The court ordered that the defendant is NOT required to reimburse Milwaukee County.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Sheriana M Finley-Sykes appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record due to no court reporter availability.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Court orders case adjourned for another status of counsel, Branch 2 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Sheriana M Finley-Sykes in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Sheriana M Finley-Sykes in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
